adjectives.description: leonine (comparative more leonine, superlative most leonine)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of a lion.
examples: His leonine face scared the young children.

entries.meaning: (numismatics, historical) A 13th-century coin minted in Europe and used in England as a debased form of the sterling silver penny, outlawed under Edward I.

description: Perhaps from Leoninus, a 12th-century canon in Paris, or from Pope Leo II.

entries.meaning: (poetry) A kind of Latin verse, generally alternate hexameter and pentameter, rhyming at the middle and end.
